content.description:
Pull onto the wall with a good right hand, no left hand, and minimal feet. Continue up for a few bolts doing balancy mantle moves in gaps between good holds. Then move up the face just left of the blunt arete on good crimps until a couple slightly insecure moves past the last bolt to the anchor.

Has kinda gritty rock but could clean up well with some traffic.
content.location: On the face/blunt arete to the right of the Houser Arete. Start off of a small pillar that usually has a couple small blocks on top.

content.description: A great route with amazing position, the Twin Sisters and a beautiful open plain sitting behind you!  The only negatives were some leftover dirt from nests and a bit of rock grain.  The moves themselves are sweet and powerful.  After traversing the rail, do a powerful transition to gain the face and really fun huecos.  After the last hueco move left to edges and a powerful move to a vertical flake.  Then gun it tot he chains.  A great climb.
content.location: Take a Hike does the same start as Gigantor, but moves left at the second bolt, following the slanting rail/flake.  On the right side of Checkered Demon.

content.description: Climb start of Checkered Demon then move right past thin holds and bolts. Pull a couple reachy moves over bulge to gain awesome flake. Finish with great positive and airy moves up flake to chains. A great route.
content.protection: bolts and hand sized pieces for start
content.location: starts on Checkered Demon and moves a few feet right onto bulge and then up through cool flake.

content.description: This route is a pretty hard hand and finger crack on the far left side of the Checkered Demon.  The belay on top is from natural gear.  From a #1 camalot to a #4 camalot.
content.protection: A set of cams is required.
content.location: On the far left side of the Wall, just left of Face Shot

content.description: Fantastic route if in the area, one the best and obscure .12s in the city! Start up large flared crack that leads to easy slab with nice stances. Get a good look up at the headwall and crank some incredible moves through small holds to god send jug at the top. Rumor has it that a key hold broke off rendering the crux (3-5 bolt)harder.
content.location: Located immediate left line of Checkered Demon(namesake route), obvious bolt line that charts its way up red patina face on headwall. Start in left wide crack and traverse into slab until first bolt.

content.description: Climb up the wide crack below Face shot and climb up to the arete using stoppers and small cams for gear.  Then climb the nice balancy arete past a couple bolts to chain anchors.
content.location: The arete just right of Face shot.

content.description:
On the right side of Checkered Demon, next to 'Take a Hike' 12d, is an amazing series of dirt-red patina plates. Gigantor begins on a 25 ft. high flake / ledge and climbs through these plates directly to the top of the feature. The climb is characterized by long, powerful moves between the plates, balance intensive footwork and a spicy finish.

Few good rests exist, and the climbing tends to get more difficult as you gain altitude. Unlike its neighbor 'Take a Hike' this climb is generally free of birds nests.
content.location: Right of 'Take a Hike' on Checkered Demon.

content.description: Climb up the center of the mottled face using nuts and small cams for pro and then past three nice bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.protection: A set of nuts and maybe some small cams.
content.location: This route is on the nice face left of the main section of the Checkered Demon.

content.description: This is a great line on the center of the Checkered Demon Cliff.  A hard, funky start is protected by a bolt and a fixed pin.  After that easier climbing above in a nice stemming dihedral to a two bolt and chain anchor near the top of the cliff.
content.location: This is the main center dihedral on the Checkered Demon Crag.  The start is marked by a bolt and a fixed pin a little above the bolt.
